trans-unit.source: Identity Providers
trans-unit.target: Identity Providers

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Identity Providers
trans-unit.target: Identity Providers

trans-unit.source: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.
trans-unit.target: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.

trans-unit.source: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.
trans-unit.target: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.

trans-unit.source: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.

trans-unit.source: In <token>firstref_acs</token>, an <newTerm>identity provider</newTerm> is a service that authenticates user or client identities and issues security tokens that <token>secondref_acs</token> consumes.
trans-unit.target: In <token>firstref_acs</token>, an <newTerm>identity provider</newTerm> is a service that authenticates user or client identities and issues security tokens that <token>secondref_acs</token> consumes.

trans-unit.source: When an identity provider is configured, <token>secondref_acs</token> trusts tokens issued by that identity provider and uses the claims in those tokens as inputs to the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine.
trans-unit.target: When an identity provider is configured, <token>secondref_acs</token> trusts tokens issued by that identity provider and uses the claims in those tokens as inputs to the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine.

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine transforms or passes through these claims and includes them in the token that it issues to the relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine transforms or passes through these claims and includes them in the token that it issues to the relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: The owner of an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> can configure one or more identity providers in their namespace.
trans-unit.target: The owner of an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> can configure one or more identity providers in their namespace.

trans-unit.source: In <token>secondref_acs</token>, an identity provider can be associated with more than one relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In <token>secondref_acs</token>, an identity provider can be associated with more than one relying party application.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, an <token>secondref_acs</token> relying party application can be associated with more than one identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, an <token>secondref_acs</token> relying party application can be associated with more than one identity provider.

trans-unit.source: For more information about relying party applications, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about relying party applications, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal provides built-in support for configuring the following identity providers:
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal provides built-in support for configuring the following identity providers:

trans-unit.source: In addition to these identity providers, <token>secondref_acs</token> supports configuration of the following identity provider types programmatically through the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service:
trans-unit.target: In addition to these identity providers, <token>secondref_acs</token> supports configuration of the following identity provider types programmatically through the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service:

trans-unit.source: WS-Trust Identity Providers
trans-unit.target: WS-Trust Identity Providers

trans-unit.source: WS-Trust identity providers pass identity claims to <token>secondref_acs</token> using the WS-Trust protocol and are most frequently used in web service scenarios.
trans-unit.target: WS-Trust identity providers pass identity claims to <token>secondref_acs</token> using the WS-Trust protocol and are most frequently used in web service scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Many WS-Trust identity providers also support WS-Federation and can be configured in <token>secondref_acs</token> as WS-Federation identity providers to create the required trust relationship.
trans-unit.target: Many WS-Trust identity providers also support WS-Federation and can be configured in <token>secondref_acs</token> as WS-Federation identity providers to create the required trust relationship.

trans-unit.source: An example of a WS-Trust identity provider is <token>firstref_adfs2</token> (also a WS-Federation identity provider), which allows you to integrate your enterprise Active Directory service accounts with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: An example of a WS-Trust identity provider is <token>firstref_adfs2</token> (also a WS-Federation identity provider), which allows you to integrate your enterprise Active Directory service accounts with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="dbc91fd8-672a-4eb9-941a-1d6a2beaa615" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Configure ADFS 2.0 as an Identity Provider</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="dbc91fd8-672a-4eb9-941a-1d6a2beaa615" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Configure ADFS 2.0 as an Identity Provider</link>.

trans-unit.source: OpenID-Based Identity Providers
trans-unit.target: OpenID-Based Identity Providers

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> supports federation with OpenID-based identity providers for web sites and web applications, using the OpenID 2.0 authentication protocol.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> supports federation with OpenID-based identity providers for web sites and web applications, using the OpenID 2.0 authentication protocol.

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> OpenID implementation allows an OpenID authentication endpoint to be configured as part of an identity provider entity in <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> OpenID implementation allows an OpenID authentication endpoint to be configured as part of an identity provider entity in <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: When an <token>secondref_acs</token> login page is rendered for a relying party application, <token>secondref_acs</token> constructs an OpenID authentication request as part of the login URL for the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: When an <token>secondref_acs</token> login page is rendered for a relying party application, <token>secondref_acs</token> constructs an OpenID authentication request as part of the login URL for the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: After a user selects the identity provider and logs in at the requested URL, the OpenID response is returned to the <token>secondref_acs</token> where it is processed by the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine.
trans-unit.target: After a user selects the identity provider and logs in at the requested URL, the OpenID response is returned to the <token>secondref_acs</token> where it is processed by the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> retrieves OpenID user attributes using the OpenID Attribute Exchange Extension and maps these attributes to claims that are then output in the token response issued to the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> retrieves OpenID user attributes using the OpenID Attribute Exchange Extension and maps these attributes to claims that are then output in the token response issued to the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: Two examples of OpenID-based identity providers that <token>secondref_acs</token> supports are Google and Yahoo!, which can be configured in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Two examples of OpenID-based identity providers that <token>secondref_acs</token> supports are Google and Yahoo!, which can be configured in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7#BKMK_4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Google</link> and <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7#BKMK_5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Yahoo!</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7#BKMK_4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Google</link> and <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7#BKMK_5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Yahoo!</link>.

trans-unit.source: Other identity providers that support OpenID 2.0 authentication endpoints can be configured programmatically using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: Other identity providers that support OpenID 2.0 authentication endpoints can be configured programmatically using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="baea3b9f-7116-4e7f-ab96-0ac2b7da41f4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Use Management Service To Configure OpenID as an Internet Identity Provider</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="baea3b9f-7116-4e7f-ab96-0ac2b7da41f4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Use Management Service To Configure OpenID as an Internet Identity Provider</link>.

trans-unit.source: Supported claim types
trans-unit.target: Supported claim types

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the claim types that are available to <token>secondref_acs</token> from OpenID identity providers.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the claim types that are available to <token>secondref_acs</token> from OpenID identity providers.

trans-unit.source: By default, claims types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.
trans-unit.target: By default, claims types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.

trans-unit.source: These URIs are also used to identify claims in other token formats.
trans-unit.target: These URIs are also used to identify claims in other token formats.

trans-unit.source: Claim Type
trans-unit.target: Claim Type

trans-unit.source: URI
trans-unit.target: URI

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name Identifier
trans-unit.target: Name Identifier

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier

trans-unit.source: An openid.claimed_id value returned by the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: An openid.claimed_id value returned by the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/name
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/name

trans-unit.source: Attribute http://axschema.org/namePerson returned by the identity provider via the OpenID Attribute Exchange extension.
trans-unit.target: Attribute http://axschema.org/namePerson returned by the identity provider via the OpenID Attribute Exchange extension.

trans-unit.source: If this attribute is not present, the claim value will be the concatenation of http://axschema.org/namePerson/first and http://axschema.org/namePerson/last.
trans-unit.target: If this attribute is not present, the claim value will be the concatenation of http://axschema.org/namePerson/first and http://axschema.org/namePerson/last.

trans-unit.source: Email Address
trans-unit.target: Email Address

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress

trans-unit.source: Attribute http://axschema.org/contact/email returned by the identity provider via the OpenID Attribute Exchange extension.
trans-unit.target: Attribute http://axschema.org/contact/email returned by the identity provider via the OpenID Attribute Exchange extension.

trans-unit.source: Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider

trans-unit.source: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application which OpenID identity provider is used to authenticate the user.
trans-unit.target: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application which OpenID identity provider is used to authenticate the user.
